se.cbb.jprime.mcmc

Interface ProperDependent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dependent
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Continuous1DPDDependent, Model
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DLRSModel, DupLossProbs, GammaDistribution, GammaSiteRateHandler, MPRMap, NormalDistribution, RBTreeArcDiscretiser, RealParameterUniformPrior, SubstitutionModel, UniformDistribution

    public interface ProperDependent
extends Dependent
    Interface for proper dependents, i.e. objects which rely on other proper dependents or state parameters. Unlike a StateParameter, a ProperDependent is itself responsible for caching and restoring its contents.

    Let D1,...,Dk be the objects on which this object relies and which have changed. Typically, methods will be invoked in this order:

    1. D1,...,Dk have changed: this.cacheAndUpdate().
    2. After entire DAG structure has been updated:
      • State has been accepted: this.clearCache().
      • State has been rejected: this.restoreCache().
    In all calls in a cycle like above, a flag is included specifying if the pending state will be sampled or not, which may be used for special processing if necessary.
    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Method Detail

      • getParentDependents

        Dependent[] getParentDependents()
        Returns all dependents on which this object relies, i.e. the parents of this vertex in the corresponding DAG.
        Returns:
        all parent dependents.

      • cacheAndUpdate

        void cacheAndUpdate(java.util.Map<Dependent,ChangeInfo> changeInfos,
                  boolean willSample)
        Caches and updates this object. It may be assumed that this method will only be invoked if a parent has in fact changed.
        Input: All changes made so far, i.e., changes to dependent objects which precede this in the dependency DAG.
        Output: Changes made to this object are added to the input.

        Behaviour must adhere to the following:

        1. This objects queries input for change info of its parents.
        2. This object caches.
        3. This object sets its own change info (null if it has not changed).
        4. Exit.
        Parameters:
        changeInfos - all changes made so far, including those of this objects parents, if any (null is interpreted as no change).
        willSample - true if the pending state will be sampled; false if not sampled. Invariant over any cacheAndUpdate()-clearCache()/restoreCache() cycle.

      • clearCache

        void clearCache(boolean willSample)
        Clears the cached (old) state when a proposed state has been accepted. It may be assumed that this method will only be invoked if a parent has in fact changed.
        Parameters:
        willSample - true if the pending state will be sampled; false if not sampled. Invariant over any cacheAndUpdate()-clearCache()/restoreCache() cycle.

      • restoreCache

        void restoreCache(boolean willSample)
        Restores the cached state when a proposed state has been rejected. It may be assumed that this method will only be invoked if a parent has in fact changed. Note that if the willSample flag is true, it may be necessary to do additional pre-processing on the restored state (since it probably originates from an earlier non-sample iteration).
        Parameters:
        willSample - true if the pending state will be sampled; false if not sampled. Invariant over any cacheAndUpdate()-clearCache()/restoreCache() cycle.
